) This IRM provides an awareness and understanding of the Branded tion Drug (BPD) Fee process for employees who may receive BPD inquiries. and (
) Purpose: This IRM section provides information to employees about the Fee imposed by section
of the Affordable Care Act (ACA). This of the ACA did not amend the Internal Revenue Code. (
) Audience: Frontline employees from all operating divisions and functions may receive BPD inquiries. (
) Policy Owner: LB&I Enterprise Activities Practice Area (
) Program Owner: ACA Team within Enterprise Activities Practice Area, Financial Institutions and Products (
) Primary Stakeholders: The primary stakeholders are organizations with the BPD team collaborates. (
) Section

of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act imposes an annual fee on the sales of BPDs to certain government programs by covered entities engaged in the business of manufacturing or importing BPDs. The ernment programs are Medicare Part B, Medicare Part D, Medicaid, any program under which BPDs are procured by the Department of Veterans Affairs, any program under which BPDs are procured by the Department of Defense, and the TRICARE retail pharmacy program. (
) A covered entity is any manufacturer or importer with gross receipts from sales. (
) Section
) sets an applicable fee amount for each year that will be apportioned among covered entities with aggregate BPD sales of over $
million to government programs or pursuant to coverage under such The applicable fee amounts for fee years are: Fee Year Applicable Amount
billion

This IRM provides an awareness and understanding of the Branded Prescrip- tion Drug (BPD) Fee process for employees who may receive BPD inquiries.

Fee Year Applicable Amount 2011 $2.5 billion 2012 $2.8 billion 2013 $2.8 billion 2014 $3.0 billion 2015 $3.0 billion 2016 $3.0 billion 2017 $4.0 billion 2018 $4.1 billion 2019 and thereafter $2.8 billion
Exhibit 25.21.1-1 provides a high level overview of the BPD fee process.

‚Ä¢ Branded Prescription Drug Fee Regulations 26 CFR 51, 26 CFR 602 TD 9823 2017-33 IRB 206 July 24, 2017 ‚Ä¢ Notice 2014-42, 2014-34 IRB 387 (1) The BPD program analysts are responsible for overseeing and administering the BPD fee. (2) A Section 9008 team is designated to administer the BPD fee. BPD inquiries questions may be directed to the team at their dedicated phone number, 1-908-301-2118 (not a toll-free number) or email at it.bpd.fee@irs.gov. (1) The following are commonly used terms and acronyms: DeÔ¨Åned Terms Term DeÔ¨Ånition Fee Year The fee year means the calendar year in which the fee for a particular sales year must be paid to the government. For example, for the fee year of 2019, the sales year is 2017. Sales Year The sales year is the second calendar year preceding the fee year. for each of these agencies: ‚Ä¢ The Centers for Medicaid and Medicare Services of the Department Health and Human Services will provide BPD sales data for the sales year by NDC for the Medicare Part D, Medicare Part B, and Medicaid programs. ‚Ä¢ The Department of Veteran Affairs will provide BPD sales data for relevant sales year by NDC and program. ‚Ä¢ The Department of Defense will provide BPD sales data for the sales year by NDC and program. ‚Ä¢ The Department of Defense will provide BPD sales data for the sales year by NDC for the TRICARE retail pharmacy program. All sales data from agencies are input into the BPD application system by and by covered entities. The annual applicable fee amount is apportioned among the covered based on the ratio between a covered entity‚Äôs BPD sales taken into during the sales year and the aggregate BPD sales taken into account the sales year for all covered entities. ). BPD sales do not include orphan drug sales.

The Centers for Medicaid and Medicare Services of the Department of Health and Human Services will provide BPD sales data for the relevant sales year by NDC for the Medicare Part D, Medicare Part B, and Medicaid programs. The Department of Veteran Affairs will provide BPD sales data for the relevant sales year by NDC and program. The Department of Defense will provide BPD sales data for the relevant sales year by NDC and program. The Department of Defense will provide BPD sales data for the relevant sales year by NDC for the TRICARE retail pharmacy program.

The annual applicable fee amount is apportioned among the covered entities based on the ratio between a covered entity‚Äôs BPD sales taken into account during the sales year and the aggregate BPD sales taken into account during the sales year for all covered entities.
BPD sales are sales of BPDs to the government programs identiÔ¨Åed in IRM 25.21.1.1.1 (1). BPD sales do not include orphan drug sales.
A covered entity‚Äôs BPD sales taken into account during the calendar year are
BPD Sales Percentage Not more than $5M 0% More than $5M but not more than $125M 10% More than $125M but not more than $225M 40% More than $225M but not more than $400M 75% More than $400M 100%
In addition to the allocated fee for the fee year, there will also be an adjust- ment calculation starting for each fee year after 2011.
The adjustment calculation reÔ¨Çects the difference between:
The allocated fee determined for the covered entity in the immediately preceding fee year, using data from the second calendar year preceding the fee year, and
What the allocated fee would have been for that entity for the immedi
ately preceding fee year, using data from the calendar year immediately preceding the fee year.
The covered entity must submit an error report with each asserted error reported on a separate line. Each error report for program errors must

) For a mathematical calculation error, the error report must identify the calculation element(s) the entity disputes and its proposed corrected tion. (
) For a rebate data error, the error report must include: ‚Ä¢ The NDC for the drug to which it relates ‚Ä¢ A discussion on whether data used in the preliminary fee matches previously reported Form
data on rebates ‚Ä¢ If data used in the preliminary fee calculation matches previously reported Form
, an explanation of why the Form
data erroneous and why the IRS should use the proposed corrected instead (

) For an error in the listing of an NDC for an orphan drug, the error report include: ‚Ä¢ The name and NDC of the orphan drug ‚Ä¢ A discussion of whether data used in the preliminary fee matches previously reported Form
data on orphan drugs ‚Ä¢ If data used in the preliminary fee calculation matches the Form data, an explanation of why the Form
was erroneous and IRS should use the proposed corrected data instead (

) For any other asserted errors not previously described, the report must contain: ‚Ä¢ An explanation of the nature of the error ‚Ä¢ How the error affects the fee calculation ‚Ä¢ An explanation of how the entity established that an error occurred ‚Ä¢ The proposed correction to the error ‚Ä¢ An explanation of why the IRS or agency should use the proposed corrected data instead See IRM
for a list of the agencies.

) Upon receipt of error reports: ‚Ä¢ Disputes for program errors are forwarded to the agencies for review and consideration. ‚Ä¢ The IRS will review and consider disputes for all other errors. (
) Any changes made pursuant to the dispute resolution process will be in the Ô¨Ånal fee calculation. (
) The Ô¨Ånal fee calculation for a fee year will be sent to each covered entity no later than August
st of each fee year. of Final Fee (
) The Ô¨Ånal fee calculation will be based on the preliminary fee calculation as (Letter
) adjusted pursuant to the dispute resolution process. (

) A covered entity‚Äôs Ô¨Ånal fee may differ from the covered entity‚Äôs preliminary calculation because of changes made pursuant to the dispute resolution process. There may be a difference in a covered entity‚Äôs fee even if the covered entity did not submit an error report because the fee is an allocated fee. (
) Each covered entity must pay its Ô¨Ånal fee by September

th of the fee the due date for payment falls on a Saturday, Sunday, or legal holiday, the of Fee may be paid on the next business day. The term ‚Äúlegal holiday‚Äù means any legal holiday in the District of Columbia. For a list of legal holidays, go to IRS.gov and enter the words ‚Äúlegal holidays‚Äù in the search box. (
) The fee must be paid by electronic funds transfer. (
) For a controlled group, the payment must be made using the designated entity‚Äôs EIN as reported on Form
All covered entities within a group are jointly and severally liable for the fee. (

and process the request to Accounting function. (
